thread.title_full: Rafael Nadal pulls out of Rotterdam Open to rest : Tennis, News - India Today

title: Rafael Nadal pulls out of Rotterdam Open to rest : Tennis, News - India Today
text:
Tennis Rafael Nadal pulls out of Rotterdam Open to rest Rafael Nadal was left out of Spain's Davis Cup squad for their World Group first-round tie against Croatia last weekend due to fatigue. Reuters | Posted by Ranit Das Nadal was also left out of Spain's Davis Cup tie vs Croatia 2 Nadal finished second to Federer in the Australian Open 3 A wrist injury cut short Nadal's season in 2016 
Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from next week's Rotterdam Open after being advised by doctors to rest, he said on Thursday. 
The Spanish world number six, who lost in five sets to old rival Roger Federer in the Australian Open final last month, was left out of Spain's Davis Cup squad for their World Group first-round tie against Croatia last weekend due to fatigue. ( Also read: Resurgent Rafael Nadal returns to Queen's Club for Aegon Championships ) 
"I am very sorry to announce I won't be able to play in Rotterdam next week," Nadal said on Twitter. 
"After last year's absence from some tournaments, I started this season well and made a significant effort during the Australian swing," he added. 
"It's because of this that my doctors have strongly advised me to take it easy and give enough rest to my body before competing again to avoid further injuries. I fully understand that the Dutch fans will be disappointed." 
A wrist injury cut short Nadal's season in 2016. For more news from India Today, follow us on Twitter @indiatoday and on Facebook at facebook.com/IndiaToday For news and videos in Hindi, go to AajTak.in . ताज़ातरीन ख़बरों और वीडियो के लिए आजतक.इन पर आएं.
